sentences.en: Anyone fomenting on advocating the leaving of Fort William Henry will be hung for sedition.
sentences.cn: 任何散布离开威廉城言论的人将被判煽动罪而处以绞刑!

sentences.en: He was brought to trial on charges of sedition.
sentences.cn: 他以煽动闹事罪被送法院审理.

sentences.en: Openly he professed loyalty, but in secret he was fanning the flame of sedition.
sentences.cn: 他表面上伪装忠诚, 暗地里却在煽动闹事.

sentences.en: They sowed sedition broadcast over the country.
sentences.cn: 他们在全国广为散布煽动性言论.

sentences.en: Trade Union leaders were charged with sedition.
sentences.cn: 工会领导人被控犯有煽动罪。

words.tran_cn: 煽动性的；扰乱治安的；参与煽动的
暴动；煽动性的言论或行为；妨害治安

trans.tran_cn: 煽动行为或言论，煽动叛乱
trans.tran_en: speech, writing, or actions intended to encourage people to disobey a government
